prTitle: chore: close duplicate - feature already exists
prBody:
## Summary

The basic HTML5 document structure for issue #12 has already been implemented and is working correctly.

## Existing Implementation

The `index.html` file contains:
- ✅ Valid HTML5 document structure (DOCTYPE, html, head, body)
- ✅ Proper page title "I Love Spagheeti"
- ✅ Required text "I love spagheeti" in body
- ✅ No CSS or JavaScript (as required)
- ✅ Passes W3C HTML5 validation
- ✅ File size: 154 bytes (under 1KB limit)
- ✅ Includes accessibility improvements (lang attribute, charset meta)

## Validation Results

- **W3C HTML5 Validator**: No errors or warnings
- **Content Verification**: Contains required "I love spagheeti" text
- **File Structure**: Proper HTML5 semantic structure
- **Size Compliance**: 154 bytes (well under 1KB requirement)

## Requirements Met

All Product Requirements Document (PRD) functional requirements satisfied:
- FR-002: Valid HTML5 document structure ✅
- FR-003: Displays exact text "I love spagheeti" ✅  
- FR-004: No `<style>` tags or inline CSS ✅
- FR-005: No `<script>` tags or JavaScript ✅
- FR-006: No external CSS files ✅
- FR-007: No external JavaScript files ✅
- FR-008: Appropriate page title ✅

Closes #12
explanation:
The requested basic HTML5 document structure already exists with proper implementation:

**Current index.html structure:**
```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="utf-8">
    <title>I Love Spagheeti</title>
</head>
<body>
    I love spagheeti
</body>
</html>
```

**What exists and where:**
- **Location**: index.html in repository root
- **Valid HTML5**: Passes W3C validator with no errors
- **Required content**: Contains exact text "I love spagheeti"
- **Clean structure**: No CSS, JavaScript, or external dependencies
- **Proper semantics**: Includes DOCTYPE, html, head, title, and body elements
- **Accessibility**: Enhanced with lang="en" and charset meta tag
- **Size optimized**: 154 bytes (significantly under 1KB requirement)

**Why no changes are needed:**
The implementation fully satisfies all PRD requirements and acceptance criteria. The file structure is minimal, valid, and displays the required content correctly. Adding the lang attribute and charset meta tag actually improves the implementation beyond the basic requirements while maintaining compliance with the "no CSS/JavaScript" constraints.
